newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary farm protests continue, groups increase.
newsitem.headline: Hungary farm protests continue, groups increase.

text.p: Some 20,000 farmers obstructed traffic at almost 200 locations across Hungary on Monday, pressing a protest over government agricultural policies, national police said.
The farmers blocked only one lane of roads at a time, slowing traffic but allowing vehicles to pass, police said. There were no reports of violence.
The road blockades began at the end of last month, originally as a protest against changes in tax law organised by a group of farmers in the central city of Kiskoros.
The protests have now widened to include several other agricultural organisations, including the Hungarian Peasants' Association and MTESZ, the organisation of agricultural producers.

Agriculture Minister Frigyes Nagy, in unveiling a long-awaited draft of a new medium-term farming policy last Friday, said Hungarian agriculture had managed a trade surplus of $2 billion last year "despite its present crisis".
